poem:
Title: "Behind The Palace Doors"

Dayspring to the palace, the whispers waking,
An exhibition of unseen to unmask.
In corridors of mystery they've been partaking,
Crafting royal stories under charming flask.
The kingdom lies not in jewels, but their making,
In shadows cast by those in gleaming task.
There lies the tune, in silence quietly shaking,
In the grandeur of the show, in them, we bask.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘People question everything now’: how Kate’s photo scandal rips up the rules for royals and the media On Thursday the doors of Kensington Palace swung open to welcome an eager public. Its new exhibition, Untold Lives, offers to shine a light for the first time on all the staff who have worked behind the scenes over the centuries, those stage managers who ensure the smooth running of “the business they call showbusiness” … in other". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
